definition: that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: My big trees were plucked up by the storm last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜那阵狂风暴雨把许多大树连根拔了起来。

sentences.english: When I was first married, I was very happy.
sentences.chinese: 我刚结婚那阵非常幸福。

sentences.english: That shower has completely soaked my clothes.
sentences.chinese: 那阵大雨把我淋得全身衣服都湿透了。

sentences.english: Then the laughter burst out afresh.
sentences.chinese: 这时候，那阵狂笑又重新爆发出来。

definition: a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
(onom.) sound of the wind or the breathing of sb who is sound asleep
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
